title: 105_hr1377
content: The Act of 1997 is titled the "Savings Are Vital to Everyone's Retirement Act" and its purpose is outlined in Section 2. The Congress finds that the retirement of the baby boom generation will strain the entitlement system, leading to increased reliance on personal savings. Studies show that many Americans have not calculated their retirement needs and lack confidence in their financial security. A major obstacle to expanding retirement savings is the lack of awareness and resources among Americans, especially the young. The purpose of this Act is to enhance public knowledge and understanding of retirement savings. The purpose of the Act is to advance public knowledge of retirement savings, hold national summits on the issue, and promote individual commitment to personal retirement savings strategies. The Department of Labor is adding a new section to promote retirement income savings under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Secretary is required to maintain an outreach program to promote retirement income savings to the public through various methods such as public service announcements, educational materials, and an Internet site. Information provided will include details on available retirement savings options for individuals and employers. The Secretary will establish a permanent Internet site providing information on retirement income savings, including different savings vehicles, steps to establish them, forms of savings, compound interest, savings principles, investing prudence, and the impact of life's uncertainties on savings. The permanent Internet site on retirement income savings will include tools for calculating retirement savings needs, descriptions of savings arrangements, and materials for employers on retirement savings. The retirement savings arrangements for workers include legal requirements, steps for establishment, educational materials, and links to additional resources on savings and investing. Coordination with other entities is also emphasized. (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents in section 1 of such Act is amended to include new items after section 514. SEC. 4. NATIONAL SUMMIT ON RETIREMENT SAVINGS. Part 5 of subtitle B of title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section for a national summit on retirement savings. The President is required to convene a National Summit on Retirement Income Savings at the White House by July 15, 1998, co-hosted by key congressional leaders. Subsequent summits are to be held in 2001 and 2005 to promote public awareness of retirement savings and develop recommendations for private pensions. The National Summit on Retirement Income Savings will be planned and conducted under the direction of the Secretary, in consultation with other Federal departments and agencies designated by the President. The Secretary will consult with congressional leaders and coordinate with private sector organizations to promote long-term financial security. The National Summit aims to increase public awareness of personal savings for retirement, educate on the importance of retirement savings, develop a public education program, identify savings challenges for workers, address barriers for employers in assisting with retirement savings, and evaluate individual retirement strategies. The curr_chunk focuses on examining the impact and effectiveness of employer and government programs in promoting retirement savings, developing recommendations for promoting private pensions and individual savings, and coordinating initiatives at different government levels. The National Summit will address issues related to individual and employer-based retirement savings, excluding those related to the Social Security Act. Participants will include professionals, Members of Congress, government officials, and private sector representatives focused on promoting retirement savings. The National Summit will focus on retirement savings for American workers and include key individuals from Congress and relevant committees. The National Summit on retirement savings for American workers will include key individuals from Congress and relevant committees, as well as up to 200 additional participants appointed by the President and elected leaders of Congress. The National Summit on retirement savings for American workers will include key individuals from Congress and relevant committees, as well as up to 200 additional participants appointed by elected leaders of Congress, without political affiliation considerations. The National Summit on retirement savings will be presided over by representatives from the executive and legislative branches. The Secretary will administer the summit by requesting cooperation from other federal departments, providing assistance to state agencies, and making the agenda available for public comment. The Secretary will organize the National Summit on retirement savings, appoint necessary personnel, and provide background materials for participants. The duties include ensuring cooperation among federal departments and state agencies, and soliciting public input on the agenda. The National Summit on retirement savings will involve broad participation from various agencies and organizations, with a published agenda and personnel appointed without political bias. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Summit. The National Summit on retirement savings is exempt from the Advisory Committee Act. The Secretary will submit a report on the Summit's activities to key officials within 90 days of its conclusion. The term 'State' includes various territories and possessions of the United States. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years starting from October 1, 1997. The Secretary may accept private contributions to defray costs of the National Summit. The financial obligation for the Department of Labor for fiscal year 1998 shall not exceed one-half of the Summit costs or $250,000. The private sector organization contracted with the Secretary will cover the remaining costs. The Secretary is authorized to enter into contracts to fulfill responsibilities under this section. The Secretary will enter into a sole-source contract to ensure the timely completion of the National Summit in fiscal year 1998. A conforming amendment will be made to the table of contents in the Act. The National Summit on Retirement Savings will be held, with key officials in attendance.
